claims.sentence: The speed of light in vacuum, commonly denoted c, is a universal physical constant exactly equal to 299,792,458 metres per second.

claims.sentence: The result of your conversion between speed of light [vacuum] and meter/second appears here To convert between Speed Of Light [vacuum] and Meter/second you have to do the following: First divide 299792458 / 1 = 299792458.

claims.sentence: The result of your conversion between speed of light [vacuum] and mile/second appears here To convert between Speed Of Light [vacuum] and Mile/second you have to do the following: First divide 299792458 / 0.3048*5280 = 186282.39705122 Then multiply the amount of Speed Of Light [vacuum] you want to convert to Mile/second, use the chart below to guide you.
claims.label: Unverifiable

claims.sentence: I take pictures – I read books – Daily photos – Daily quotes “The speed of light in a vacuum is a defined quantity: 299,792,458 m/s exactly” – How to Teach Relativity to Your Dog by Chad Orzel ich hoffe das würmer, schnecken und anderes getier auch lesen können ;–) Das kann man kaum verlangen, denn: ich las das, machte ein Foto und entdeckte dann dahinter was, was ich unbedingt fotografieren musste und bin einfach dran vorbeimarschiert.
claims.label: Unverifiable

evidence.text: The speed of light in vacuum, commonly denoted c, is a universal physical constant exactly equal to 299,792,458 metres per second. It is exact because, by international agreement, a metre is defined as the length of the path travelled by light in vacuum during a time interval of 1⁄299792458 second. The speed of light is the same for all observers, no matter their relative velocity. It is the upper limit for the speed at which information, matter, or energy can travel through space.
evidence.title: Speed of light

evidence.text: Vacuum permittivity, commonly denoted ε0, is the value of the absolute dielectric permittivity of classical vacuum. It may also be referred to as the permittivity of free space, the electric constant, or the distributed capacitance of the vacuum. It is an ideal (baseline) physical constant. Its CODATA value is:
evidence.title: Vacuum permittivity

evidence.text: The result of your conversion between speed of light [vacuum] and meter/second appears here To convert between Speed Of Light [vacuum] and Meter/second you have to do the following: First divide 299792458 / 1 = 299792458. Then multiply the amount of Speed Of Light [vacuum] you want to convert to Meter/second, use the chart below to guide you.
